title: Policy rate
text:
This R document presents the process for loading, munging and plotting the evolution of the daily daily-frequency of the policy rate of the Central Bank of Colombia, Banco de la República. The information is published by Banrep and you can download it here.
The first step is to load the following libraries:
# Load libraries

library(readxl)
library(tidyverse)
library(lubridate)
library(janitor)

title: Policy rate
text:
Load data
Now we can load the data:

# Load data

data = readxl::read_excel("graficador_series.xlsx",
                          sheet = "Datos",
                          range = "A1:I10133",
                          col_names = TRUE,
                          na = "-",
                          .name_repair = make_clean_names)

title: Policy rate
text:
Indexing

# Let's omit the first row

data = data[-c(1), ]

title: Policy rate
text:
Transformation
Now we transform the date column with as.Datefunction:

# Parsing to date

data = data |> 
  dplyr::mutate(
    fecha = as.Date(fecha, format = "%d/%m/%Y"))

Now, we can create the new columns: year month and day, from the date variable with the lubridate functions:

# Extract information

data$año = lubridate::year(data$fecha)
data$mes = lubridate::month(data$fecha)
data$dia = lubridate::day(data$fecha)

glimpse(data)

$ dia                                              <int> 13, 14, 15, 16, 17, 1…



# Converting Tasa diaria to 'double' format replacing "," -> "."

data = data |>
  dplyr::select(fecha, año,
                mes, dia,
                tasa_de_politica_monetaria_dato_diario) |> 
  dplyr::mutate(
    tasa_de_politica_monetaria_dato_diario = 
      as.numeric(str_replace_all(
        string = tasa_de_politica_monetaria_dato_diario,
        pattern = ",",
        replacement = ".")))

data

title: Policy rate
text:
Filtering
Now we can filter the database for the first month of every year starting from 2015:

# Filter the data

data = data |> 
  filter(año >= 2015)

title: Policy rate
text:
Graph

# Create the plot

data |> 
ggplot(aes(x=fecha, y=tasa_de_politica_monetaria_dato_diario)) +
  geom_step(color="darkblue") +
  scale_x_date(date_breaks = "1 year", date_labels = "%m-%Y") +
  scale_y_continuous(breaks = seq(0,14, by = 2)) +
  theme_bw() +
  labs(title = "Tasa de intervención de política monetaria",
       subtitle = "(periodicidad diaria)",
       x = "Mes-Año",
       y = "Tasa (%)",
       caption = "Fuente: Elaboración propia con datos del Banco de la República, TIP") +
  theme(plot.caption.position = "panel",
        plot.caption = element_text(hjust = 0))

title: Policy rate
text:
Conclusion
In the previous graph we can see the latest monetary policy decisions by the Banco de la República regarding the REPO rate. Since the constitutional instruction is to maintain the purchasing power of the different agents of the economy and the inflation expectations anchored to an interval, we can observe that the REPO rate was reduced to get resources to finance the pandemic, and then quickly escalated in order to contain the raising inflation after the pandemic. It is worth mentioning that the latest minutes report discretion about reducing very quickly the interest rate levels, due to inflation levels, inflation expectations and external financing conditions.
